message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CC. 

The paper presents a new question answering dataset in the legal domain, which requires the ability of logic reasoning. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the natural language processing (NLP) field of computer science. Specifically, the paper focuses on machine comprehension, which is a subfield of NLP that aims to enable machines to understand and answer questions posed in natural language. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language). 

In addition, the paper mentions that state-of-the-art models can only achieve about 28% accuracy on the JEC-QA dataset, which suggests that the paper is also related to artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely sub-categories. 

Furthermore, the paper involves information retrieval (IR) and reasoning, which are important components of question answering systems. Therefore, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) are also possible sub-categories.
